Instruction: Combine buttermilk, mustard, salt, pepper, and cayenne in a bowl and whisk together.
Marinate chicken pieces in the refrigerator with the buttermilk marinade in a resealable plastic bag for 2 to 8 hours.
Mix flour, baking powder, garlic and onion powder in a separate resealable plastic bag and shake well to combine.

Take one piece of marinated chicken at a time, place it in the bag with the flour mixture, seal the bag, and shake to coat the chicken well. Repeat the process by dipping the coated chicken back into the buttermilk marinade and shaking it again in the dry coating. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat and add the chicken to the pan.

Cook the chicken in batches in hot oil, turning occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through. Use a thermometer to ensure the internal temperature reaches at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Plate while warm and savor every bite!
